publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3405 Mr Brian Monteith: The Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Walesâ€”That the Parliament notes that, by Royal Charter of Queen Victoria on 11 May 1880, the Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales was established as a corporate body; also notes the unbroken global convention from Nova Scotia to Scotland, Ireland, South Africa, Guyana, India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Manitoba, Jamaica, Bermuda, Prince Edward Island, Sri Lanka, Zimbabwe, Nepal, Nigeria, the Caribbean, Australia and New Zealand that chartered institutes carry their country of origin in their names; further notes the intention of the Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales to amend its title to "The Institute of Chartered Accountants", creating market place confusion and asserting unjustified and inaccurate claims of pre-eminence, and calls on HM Privy Council not to approve the proposed name change.

S2M-3405 The Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales (lodged on 7 October 2005) Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Stewart Stevenson*, Margaret Mitchell*, Brian Adam*, Phil Gallie*, Mr David Davidson*, Derek Brownlee* R, Nora Radcliffe*, Jim Mather*, Murdo Fraser*, Mr Duncan McNeil*
S2M-3405 The Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales (lodged on 7 October 2005) Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Eleanor Scott*
S2M-3405 The Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales (lodged on 7 October 2005) John Scott*
S2M-3405 The Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales (lodged on 7 October 2005) Donald Gorrie*

S2M-3405 The Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales (lodged on 7 October 2005) Ms Wendy Alexander*, Nicola Sturgeon*, Fiona Hyslop*, Rob Gibson*, Michael McMahon*, Mike Pringle*, Bruce Crawford*, Richard Lochhead*, Christine Grahame*, Mr John Swinney*, Alex Fergusson*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*
S2M-3405 The Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales (lodged on 7 October 2005) Mark Ballard*, Mr Ted Brocklebank*
S2M-3405 The Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales (lodged on 7 October 2005) Sarah Boyack*
